name: The_Warren_Commission_Report
text:
The Warren Commission Report
The Warren Commission Report: The Official Report of the President's Commission on the Assassination of President John F. Kennedy was a published report of an investigation into the death of President John F. Kennedy.
The report was a favorite book of Dale Cooper and a copy was kept at the Bookhouse.
Behind the scenes
The Warren Commission was an investigation ordered by United States President Lyndon B. Johnson in 1963 to investigate the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
The report concluded that Kennedy was killed by Lee Harvey Oswald, who acted entirely alone.
Agent Cooper expresses doubt over the commission's findings in Episode 1.
